q: Who is Sam?
a: Sam, also known as Shuaib Ahamed, is a software engineer and embedded systems enthusiast from Bangladesh, currently based in Washington State, USA.

q: What are Sam’s main technical skills?
a: Sam works with Go (Gin), MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Flutter, React Native, and embedded C. He also builds projects using ESP32, PlatformIO, and Arduino-based hardware.

q: What kind of projects has Sam worked on?
a: Sam has built a QR-based event check-in platform, an ESP32-powered wallet display, AI glasses that suggest chess moves, and an automated chess-playing robot.

q: What frontend technologies does Sam use?
a: Sam uses Flutter for mobile apps and React Native without Expo for cross-platform development.

q: What backend stack does Sam use?
a: He builds backends in Go using the Gin framework, with REST APIs, JWT authentication, MongoDB/PostgreSQL databases, and Docker deployments to Google Cloud Run.

q: What is Sam studying?
a: Sam is currently studying computer science at Edmonds College and is working toward his bachelor's degree.

q: Where did Sam intern?
a: He interned at Autev as a Robotics Software Engineer, working with ROS, Gazebo, and Isaac Sim. He also interned at CoMotion Lab building an AI chatbot for shelters.

q: What is the Magnetic Media Group project Sam worked on?
a: Sam built a full-stack event management platform for Magnetic Media Group, including QR-based attendee check-in, Google Sheets integration, and backend logic in Go.

q: Is Sam into embedded systems?
a: Yes, Sam is deeply into embedded systems and 3D printing. He builds smart devices using ESP32, LED displays, stepper motors, and is learning PCB design.

q: Does Sam build robots?
a: Yes, he built an autonomous chess robot, and is working on a split-flap display, smart fridge device, and plans to build a robotic arm with 3D printed parts.

q: Does Sam do 3D printing?
a: Yes, he owns a Bambu Lab A1 printer and regularly designs and prints enclosures for his embedded hardware projects.

q: What is Sam like as a person?
a: Sam is passionate about tech, loves building things that are useful or fun, and prefers to explain things simply. He’s a builder, a thinker, and a bit of a dreamer.

q: What are Sam’s long-term goals?
a: Sam wants to become an expert in embedded systems and hardware repair, build and sell his own tech products, and help others learn computer science.

q: What languages does Sam speak?
a: Sam speaks Bengali and English.

q: Where can I find Sam’s work?
a: Sam’s portfolio is at https://www.shuaib.pw, where you can see his projects and contact him.

q: How can I contact Sam?
a: Use the contact form on his website https://www.shuaib.pw or connect with him via LinkedIn.

q: Is Sam building anything with AI?
a: Yes, Sam built a recipe LLM that suggests recipes based on ingredients and expiration dates. He's also experimenting with building his own AI voice generator and chatbot.

q: Where is Sam located?
a: Sam is based in Washington State, USA.

q: Why did Sam choose computer science?
a: Sam believes computer science lets you build things with meaning. To him, it’s not just a major — it’s a passion.

q: What are Sam’s hobbies?
a: Building electronics, 3D printing, working on hardware projects, writing Go code, and making his own smart home devices.

q: What program is Sam currently enrolled in?
a: Sam is an international student at Edmonds College pursuing an Associate of Arts in Computer Science.

q: What courses has Sam completed?
a: Sam has completed CS 141 Intro to Programming in Java, CS 142 Intermediate Java, CS 143 Data Structures in Java, and Anthropology 215 Bioanthropology.

q: Has Sam earned any certifications?
a: Yes, Sam took a certification class in Java at Edmonds College.

q: Has Sam held any academic roles?
a: Yes, Sam served as a Peer Mentor in the RiSE Program at Edmonds College during Fall 2024.

q: What topics has Sam been self-teaching?
a: Sam has been self-teaching embedded systems with C and ESP32, Go with Gin backend development, Flutter mobile and web apps, ROS and ROS2 using C++ and Python, and Quran reading.

q: What are Sam's future education plans?
a: Sam plans to transfer to a bachelor's program in computer science after completing his AA at Edmonds College.
